extendedIngredients.name: sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons sun dried tomatoes in oil, very finely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup warm water (120 - 130°F*** this is IMPORTANT! Rapid Rise Yeast calls for warmer water than regular active dry yeast. It should be warm to the touch but not hot)
metaInformation: for warmer water than regular active  yeast. it should be warm to the touch but not )

extendedIngredients.name: yeast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (1/4 ounce) package Fleischmann's Rapid Rise Yeast

recipes.title: Sun Dried Tomato Breadsticks

winePairing.pairingText: Fingerfood works really well with Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. You could try Bellissima Sparkling rosé. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: In a large bowl whisk together 1 cup of the flour, sugar, Fleischmann's Rapid Rise Yeast, and salt. In a liquid measuring cup measure out the warm water and add the 2 teaspoons of oil. Check the temperature with your fingers or an instant read thermometer.Pour the liquid into the dry mixture, add the egg white and stir until combined.Gradually add in the remaining 1 - 1 cups of flour ( I add  -  cup at a time) until the dough forms a ball. Add the sun dried tomatoes to the dough, fold it once or twice in the bowl to incorporate, and then turn the dough out onto a floured surface.Knead for about 6 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic and springs back lightly when pressed with two fingers (I actually only had to knead for 3-4 minutes to achieve the right texture).Cover the dough with a towel and let it rest for 10 minutes.Cut the dough into thirds. Then cut each third into fourths, yielding 12 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 10" rope (I do this with floured hands to make it a little easier).Place the breadsticks on a greased baking sheet -- if you have to crowd them it's fine, but you will have to pull them apart after they bake. 2" between each breadstick will prevent them from baking together.Brush the tops with the remaining 1 tablespoion oil and sprinkle all over with the Parmesan cheese.Cover the breadsticks again with the towel and let them rise in a warm place (I use my stove top) for about 30 minutes, until they double in size.Preheat the oven to 450F. Bake for 10 - 14 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm.

steps.step: In a large bowl whisk together 1 cup of the flour, sugar, Fleischmann's Rapid Rise Yeast, and salt. In a liquid measuring cup measure out the warm water and add the 2 teaspoons of oil. Check the temperature with your fingers or an instant read thermometer.
Pour the liquid into the dry mixture, add the egg white and stir until combined.Gradually add in the remaining 1 - 1 cups of flour ( I add  -  cup at a time) until the dough forms a ball.

Add the sun dried tomatoes to the dough, fold it once or twice in the bowl to incorporate, and then turn the dough out onto a floured surface.Knead for about 6 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic and springs back lightly when pressed with two fingers (I actually only had to knead for 3-4 minutes to achieve the right texture).Cover the dough with a towel and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Cut the dough into thirds. Then cut each third into fourths, yielding 12 equal pieces.
Roll each piece into a 10" rope (I do this with floured hands to make it a little easier).

Place the breadsticks on a greased baking sheet -- if you have to crowd them it's fine, but you will have to pull them apart after they bake. 2" between each breadstick will prevent them from baking together.

Brush the tops with the remaining 1 tablespoion oil and sprinkle all over with the Parmesan cheese.Cover the breadsticks again with the towel and let them rise in a warm place (I use my stove top) for about 30 minutes, until they double in size.Preheat the oven to 450F.
Bake for 10 - 14 minutes, or until golden brown.
